name: St. John Roberts

locations.description: Benedictine priest martyred in London, England

summary: John Roberts was a Welsh Benedictine monk and priest who was martyred during the reign of James I. He was ordained in Spain and made several trips to England to minister to Catholics. He was arrested multiple times, exiled, but kept returning. He was eventually captured, tried, and executed at Tyburn. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is remembered for his persistence in serving the Catholic faithful despite repeated arrests.
